intro: Ceropegia luteiflora, commonly known as the yellow-flowered ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asclepiadaceae family and is characterized by its trailing stems and distinctive, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are often covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained soil and sunny conditions. It is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral structure. Ceropegia luteiflora is also known for its ability to produce a milky sap, which can be toxic if ingested.
